1.text: Be ye imitators of me, even as I also am of Christ.

2.text: Now I praise you that ye remember me in all things, and hold fast the traditions, even as I delivered them to you.

3.text: But I would have you know, that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the woman is the man; and the head of Christ is God.

4.text: Every man praying or prophesying, having his head covered, dishonoureth his head.

5.text: But every woman praying or prophesying with her head unveiled dishonoureth her head: for it is one and the same thing as if she were shaven.

6.text: For if a woman is not veiled, let her also be shorn: but if it is a shame to a woman to be shorn or shaven, let her be veiled.

7.text: For a man indeed ought not to have his head veiled, forasmuch as he is the image and glory of God: but the woman is the glory of the man.

8.text: For the man is not of the woman; but the woman of the man:

9.text: for neither was the man created for the woman; but the woman for the man:

10.text: for this cause ought the woman to have a sign of authority on her head, because of the angels.

11.text: Howbeit neither is the woman without the man, nor the man without the woman, in the Lord.

12.text: For as the woman is of the man, so is the man also by the woman; but all things are of God.

13.text: Judge ye in yourselves: is it seemly that a woman pray unto God unveiled?

14.text: Doth not even nature itself teach you, that, if a man have long hair, it is a dishonour to him?

15.text: But if a woman have long hair, it is a glory to her: for her hair is given her for a covering.

16.text: But if any man seemeth to be contentious, we have no such custom, neither the churches of God.

17.text: But in giving you this charge, I praise you not, that ye come together not for the better but for the worse.

18.text: For first of all, when ye come together in the church, I hear that divisions exist among you; and I partly believe it.

19.text: For there must be also heresies among you, that they which are approved may be made manifest among you.

20.text: When therefore ye assemble yourselves together, it is not possible to eat the Lord’s supper:

21.text: for in your eating each one taketh before other his own supper; and one is hungry, and another is drunken.

22.text: What? have ye not houses to eat and to drink in? or despise ye the church of God, and put them to shame that have not? What shall I say to you? shall I praise you in this? I praise you not.

23.text: For I received of the Lord that which also I delivered unto you, how that the Lord Jesus in the night in which he was betrayed took bread;

24.text: and when he had given thanks, he brake it, and said, This is my body, which is for you: this do in remembrance of me.

25.text: In like manner also the cup, after supper, saying, This cup is the new covenant in my blood: this do, as oft as ye drink it, in remembrance of me.

26.text: For as often as ye eat this bread, and drink the cup, ye proclaim the Lord’s death till he come.

27.text: Wherefore whosoever shall eat the bread or drink the cup of the Lord unworthily, shall be guilty of the body and the blood of the Lord.

28.text: But let a man prove himself, and so let him eat of the bread, and drink of the cup.

29.text: For he that eateth and drinketh, eateth and drinketh judgment unto himself, if he discern not the body.

30.text: For this cause many among you are weak and sickly, and not a few sleep.

31.text: But if we discerned ourselves, we should not be judged.

32.text: But when we are judged, we are chastened of the Lord, that we may not be condemned with the world.

33.text: Wherefore, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, wait one for another.

34.text: If any man is hungry, let him eat at home; that your coming together be not unto judgment. And the rest will I set in order whensoever I come.
